description: `AreaChart` is a component for drawing area charts to compare multiple sets of data.

description: Yamada UI provides prebuilt components to help you build projects faster.
title: Components

description: `AspectRatio` is a component for embedding things like videos and maps while maintaining the aspect ratio.
title: AspectRatio

description: `Bleed` is a component used to extend elements beyond the boundaries of a container.
title: Bleed

description: `Box` is the most abstract component on which all other components are built. By default, it renders a `div` element.
title: Box

description: `Center` is a component that aligns the child elements in the center within the component.
title: Center

description: `Container` is a component used as a general division element. By default, it renders the `section` element.
title: Container

description: `Divider` is a component that represents a division between elements.
title: Divider

description: `Flex` is a component that sets `flex` to `Box`. Also, convenient style shorthand is available.
title: Flex

description: `Float` is a component used to fix elements to the edges of a container.
title: Float

description: `Grid` is a component for managing grid layouts. It also comes with handy style shorthand.
title: Grid

description: Components for building the layout of the project, such as `Box` and `Stack`, are available.
title: Layouts

description: `SimpleGrid` is a component that makes `Grid` simpler and more user-friendly.
title: SimpleGrid

hierarchy.lv3: Setting the Minimum Width for Children

title: Setting the Minimum Width for Children

description: `Spacer` is a component used to add space between elements.
title: Spacer

description: `Stack` is a component that groups elements and provides spacing between child elements.
title: Stack

description: `Wrap` is a component that has `wrap` set on `Flex`. It inherits convenient style shorthand from `Flex`.
title: Wrap

description: `Avatar` is a component that displays a profile picture or an icon with initials representing a user.
title: Avatar

description: `@yamada-ui/fontawesome` provides convenient components for using [Font Awesome](https://fontawesome.com).
title: Fontawesome Icon

description: `Icon` is a general icon component that can be used in your projects.
title: Icon

description: `Image` is a component that displays images with fallback support.
title: Image

description: Components such as `Icon` and `Image` are available to embed images and `svg` into your project.
title: Media and Icons

description: `Indicator` is a component that displays at the corner of elements such as avatars.
title: Indicator

description: `@yamada-ui/lucide` is a component that incorporates the Yamada UI style system into [Lucide](https://lucide.dev) icons.
title: Lucide Icon

description: `NativeImage` is renders a `img` element.
title: NativeImage

description: `Picture` is a component that uses the `picture` element to provide alternative images for different display and device scenarios.
title: Picture

description: `Breadcrumb` is a component that helps users understand the hierarchy of a website.
title: Breadcrumb

hierarchy.lv3: Use an Icon as a Separator

title: Use an Icon as a Separator

hierarchy.lv3: Display Ellipsis Items in a Menu

title: Display Ellipsis Items in a Menu

description: Components such as `Link` and `Breadcrumb` are available to display hyperlinks and the location of pages within the project.
title: Navigation

description: `Link` is a component for creating hyperlinks to different web pages, locations within the same page, or other URLs.
title: Link

description: `LinkBox` is a component that allows elements such as articles or cards to function as a single link.
title: LinkBox

description: `Pagination` is a component for managing the pagination and navigation of content.
title: Pagination

description: `Stepper` is a component that displays the progress of a multi-step process.
title: Stepper

description: `CloseButton` is a component used primarily to trigger the close functionality of a component.
title: CloseButton

description: We are currently considering the development of `EmptyState`.
title: EmptyState

description: `FocusLock` is a component that improves accessibility by restricting focus within elements such as modals and dialogs, and locking the focus within that range.
title: FocusLock

description: We are currently considering the development of `For`.
title: For

description: We are currently considering the development of `FormatByte`.
title: FormatByte

description: We are currently considering the development of `FormatNumber`.
title: FormatNumber

description: Other useful components such as `Ripple` and `Portal` are available.
title: Other

description: `Motion` is a convenient component that extends the Yamada UI style system to `framer-motion`.
title: Motion

description: `Portal` is a component that renders elements outside of the current `DOM` hierarchy.
title: Portal

hierarchy.lv3: Changing the Destination of Nested Portals

title: Changing the Destination of Nested Portals

description: `Ripple` is a component that adds a ripple effect to elements, allowing users to recognize when they have clicked.
title: Ripple

description: We are currently considering the development of `Swipeable`.
title: Swipeable

description: `VisuallyHidden` is a common technique used in web accessibility to hide content from the visual client, but keep it readable for screen readers.
title: VisuallyHidden

description: We are currently considering the development of `ActionBar`.
title: ActionBar

description: `ContextMenu` is triggered by a right click and displays a menu at the pointer's position.
title: ContextMenu

hierarchy.lv3: Keeping the Menu Open After Item Selection

title: Keeping the Menu Open After Item Selection

hierarchy.lv3: Keeping the Menu Open When Focus is Lost

title: Keeping the Menu Open When Focus is Lost

description: `Dialog` is a component used to confirm or interrupt user actions.
title: Dialog

hierarchy.lv3: Do Not Block Scroll When Dialog Opens

title: Do Not Block Scroll When Dialog Opens

description: `Drawer` is a component for a panel that appears from the edge of the screen.
title: Drawer

hierarchy.lv3: Do Not Block Scroll on Mount

title: Do Not Block Scroll on Mount

description: Components such as `Modal` and `Drawer` are available to temporarily block interactions with the background UI.
title: Overlay

description: `Menu` is a component that displays a common dropdown menu.
title: Menu

hierarchy.lv3: Keeping the Menu Open When an Item is Selected

title: Keeping the Menu Open When an Item is Selected

hierarchy.lv3: Keeping the Menu Open When Focus is Lost

title: Keeping the Menu Open When Focus is Lost

description: `Modal` is a component that is displayed over the main content to focus the user's attention solely on the information.
title: Modal

hierarchy.lv3: Do Not Block Scroll When Modal Opens

title: Do Not Block Scroll When Modal Opens

description: `Popover` is a component that floats around an element to display information.
title: Popover

hierarchy.lv3: Displaying Based on a Different Element

title: Displaying Based on a Different Element

description: `Tooltip` is a component that displays short information, such as supplementary details for an element.
title: Tooltip

description: We are currently considering the development of `Tour`.
title: Tour

description: `Airy` is a component that provides a smooth animation to switch between two elements.
title: Airy

description: `Collapse` is a component that allows you to expand or collapse an element for display.
title: Collapse

description: `Fade` is a component that gradually shows or hides an element.
title: Fade

description: `Flip` is a component that provides an animation to switch between two elements while flipping.
title: Flip

description: Components such as `Collapse` and `Fade` are available to provide animations to elements, creating visual transitions.
title: Transitions

description: `Rotate` is a component that provides an animation to switch between two elements while rotating.
title: Rotate

description: `ScaleFade` is a component that gradually scales up to reveal or scales down to hide an element.
title: ScaleFade

description: `Slide` is a component that shows or hides an element from the corners of the page.
title: Slide

description: `SlideFade` is a component that gradually shows or hides an element while moving it from a specified position.
title: SlideFade

description: `Blockquote` is a component that represents a quotation. By default, it renders a `blockquote` element.
title: Blockquote

description: `Code` is a component that represents a code block. By default, it renders a `code` element.
title: Code

description: `Em` is a component that represents emphasized text. By default, it renders a `em` element.
title: Em

description: `Heading` is a component that represents section headings. By default, it renders an `h1` element.
title: Heading

description: `Highlight` is a component that highlights specified strings within text. By default, it renders a `p` element.
title: Highlight

description: Components such as `Heading` and `Text` are available for constructing text in your project.
title: Typography

description: `Text` is a component that represents a paragraph of text. By default, it renders a `p` element.
title: Text

description: How to install and use Yamada UI in your project.
title: Installation

description: Convenient custom hooks are provided in Yamada UI to help you build your projects more quickly.
title: Hooks

description: `useAnimation` is a custom hook that implements animations similar to CSS `keyframes`.
title: useAnimation

description: `useAsyncCallback` is a custom hook for managing asynchronous callbacks.
title: useAsyncCallback

description: `useAsync` is a custom hook that executes an asynchronous function and tracks its state.
title: useAsync

description: `useBoolean` is a custom hook used to manage boolean values using `on`, `off`, and `toggle` functions.
title: useBoolean

description: `useBreakpointEffect` is a custom hook that executes a specific callback function when the breakpoint changes.
title: useBreakpointEffect

description: `useBreakpointState` is a custom hook that takes a responsive object as an initial state and returns a state corresponding to the current breakpoint.
title: useBreakpointState

description: `useBreakpointValue` is a custom hook that returns the value of the current breakpoint from the provided object. This hook monitors changes in the window size and returns the appropriate value.
title: useBreakpointValue

description: `useBreakpoint` is a custom hook that returns the current breakpoint. This hook monitors changes in the window size and returns the appropriate value.
title: useBreakpoint

description: `useClipboard` is a custom hook that performs the operation of copying a value to the clipboard.
title: useClipboard

description: `useColorModeValue` is a custom hook that returns the value of the current color mode from the provided values.
title: useColorModeValue

description: `useColorMode` is a custom hook that returns the current color mode.
title: useColorMode

description: `useDisclosure` is a custom hook that helps handle common open/close or toggle scenarios. It can be used to control components such as `Modal`, `Dialog`, `Drawer`, etc.
title: useDisclosure

description: `useDynamicAnimation` is a custom hook used to switch animations.
title: useDynamicAnimation

description: `useHover` is a custom hook that detects whether the pointer has moved over or away from an element.
title: useHover

description: `useIdle` is a custom hook that detects whether the user has been idle for a certain amount of time in milliseconds.
title: useIdle

description: `useInfiniteScroll` is a custom hook that provides infinite scroll functionality.
title: useInfiniteScroll

description: `useInterval` is a custom hook that runs a function at a specified interval.
title: useInterval

description: `useLoading` is a custom hook for controlling the loading of the application.
title: useLoading

description: `useLocalStorage` is a custom hook for storing, updating, and retrieving values in local storage.
title: useLocalStorage

description: `useMediaQuery` is a custom hook that detects whether it matches a single or multiple media queries.
title: useMediaQuery

description: `useNotice` is a custom hook that controls the notifications of the application.
title: useNotice

description: `useOS` is a custom hook that returns the user's OS.
title: useOS

description: `useOutsideClick` is a custom hook that detects click events outside of an element.
title: useOutsideClick

description: `usePrevious` is a custom hook for obtaining the previous value.
title: usePrevious

description: `useProcessing` is a custom hook for handling processing states.
title: useProcessing

description: `usePromiseDisclosure` is a custom hook that helps handle common open/close or toggle scenarios with promises. It can be used to control components such as `Modal`, `Dialog`, `Drawer`, etc.
title: usePromiseDisclosure

description: `useResizeObserver` is a custom hook that tracks changes in the size and position of an element.
title: useResizeObserver

description: `useSnacks` is a custom hook for controlling notifications used in forms and other similar situations.
title: useSnacks

description: `useTheme` is a custom hook that returns a function for retrieving and switching themes.
title: useTheme

description: `useTimeout` is a custom hook that executes a function after a specified number of milliseconds.
title: useTimeout

description: `useToken` is a custom hook for retrieving tokens from the theme.
title: useToken

description: `useBreakpointEffect` is a custom hook that skips the side effect on the initial render and executes a specific callback function when the breakpoint changes.
title: useBreakpointEffect

description: `useUpdateEffect` is a custom hook that skips side effects on the initial render, and only runs them when the dependency array changes.
title: useUpdateEffect

description: `useValue` is a custom hook that combines `useBreakpointValue` and `useColorModeValue`.
title: useValue

description: `useWindowEvent` is a custom hook that assigns an event listener to `window`.
title: useWindowEvent

title: Animation

description: Learn about the Style props and themes of Yamada UI. Style props is a method to change the style of a component just by passing props to the component.
title: Styled System

description: A method for easily accessing CSS custom properties (variables) in the Yamada UI style system.
title: Interpolation

description: Yamada UI supports the loading animations needed in applications.
title: Loading

description: Yamada UI supports the necessary notifications in the application.
title: Notification
